meanings.definition: To let saliva or liquid run from the mouth; drool.
meanings.sent2: The dog slabbered all over the floor.
meanings.sent3: The toddler slabbered happily as he played with his toys.
meanings.sent4: The leaky faucet slabbered water non-stop.
meanings.sent5: The delicious food made him slabber with anticipation.

meanings.definition: To speak in a sloppy, incoherent manner.
meanings.sent1: The drunk man slabbered his words at the bar.
meanings.sent2: The tired professor slabbered through his lecture.
meanings.sent3: The comedian slabbered jokes that no one understood.
meanings.sent4: The radio host slabbered on air, causing confusion.
meanings.sent5: The politician slabbered during the debate, losing his audience.

meanings.sent1: The slabbered bib was evidence of a messy meal.
meanings.sent2: The slabbered pillow was uncomfortable to sleep on.
meanings.sent3: The slabbered shirt needed a good wash.
meanings.sent4: The slabbered dog left a trail of wet paw prints.
meanings.sent5: The slabbered window was hard to see through.
